meanings.definition: The quality or state of being restrictive.
meanings.sent1: The restrictiveness of the rules made it hard to have fun.
meanings.sent2: The restrictiveness of the dress code made it difficult to express personal style.
meanings.sent3: The restrictiveness of the diet plan was so strict, even the vegetables felt trapped.
meanings.sent4: The restrictiveness of the regulations felt like a heavy weight on everyone's shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The restrictiveness of the schedule made it feel like there was no room for spontaneity.

meanings.definition: The act of imposing limitations or constraints.
meanings.sent1: Her restrictiveness on screen time helped her children focus on other activities.
meanings.sent2: The restrictiveness of the budget forced the team to get creative with their resources.
meanings.sent3: The restrictiveness of the traffic laws made the drivers feel like they were in a slow-motion race.
meanings.sent4: The restrictiveness of the contract made negotiations feel like a battle of wills.
meanings.sent5: The restrictiveness of the deadline added a sense of urgency to the project.
